alert.note: Alert for Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:47AM CDT until July 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kansas... Mill Creek at Washington affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mill Creek at Washington. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Low lands along the creek flood from Morrowville to Washington flood. At 19.0 feet, Osage Road, located 2 miles west and 1 mile north of Washington, floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 2.9 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/top/.
